summary:
Israel's prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu, vowed today to "finish the job" as Israeli strikes in Gaza killed at least 60 Palestinians, according to Al Jazeera, marking an escalation that complicates diplomacy. At the same time, former President Donald Trump suggested a Gaza ceasefire deal may be near, per Deutsche Welle, even as Netanyahu rejects a Palestinian state. A separate development—the return of UN sanctions on Iran after an unsuccessful delay attempt, reported by Al Jazeera—could harden regional alignments and affect prospects for a negotiated pause. Diplomats face urgent pressure to secure a ceasefire or risk broader regional spillover; expect intensified shuttle diplomacy and possible sanctions moves in the coming days.

Elsewhere, legal rulings, rights restrictions and security incidents reshaped policy choices and civil liberties. The U.S. Supreme Court allowed the Trump administration to withhold about $4 billion in foreign aid, per NPR, a ruling that may alter how governments use aid and prompt lawmakers to reconsider funding rules. The UN says Iran uses drones, facial recognition and a citizen app to enforce hijab rules, raising surveillance and rights concerns, while Slovakia passed a law limiting sex recognition and adoption that critics say will increase discrimination. France's Sarkozy verdict tests judicial independence, and Danish reports of Russian-linked drone flights underline hybrid-warfare risks. Expect court appeals, EU debates and targeted diplomatic or sanctions steps within weeks.

headlines.title: Netanyahu vows to finish the job as Gaza strikes continue
headlines.summary: Netanyahu says he will finish the job as strikes escalate, with at least 60 Palestinians killed, signaling a broader conflict and prompting calls for de-escalation.

headlines.title: UN sanctions on Iran return after delay bid
headlines.summary: Observers say the move sets the stage for renewed pressure on Tehran and could affect nuclear talks and regional diplomacy.

headlines.title: Supreme Court allows Trump to withhold $4 billion in foreign aid
headlines.summary: NPR says the court's majority upholds Trump's authority to withhold aid, outweighing alleged harms cited by aid groups, raising questions about future foreign assistance.

headlines.title: UN says Iran uses drones to enforce hijab law
headlines.summary: UN says Iran uses drones, facial recognition, and a citizen app to crack down on hijab violations, raising concerns about civil liberties and state surveillance.

headlines.title: Slovakia passes law to recognise only two sexes and restrict adoption
headlines.summary: Critics warn the change will heighten discrimination against LGBT people and complicate family life; supporters say the measure aligns with traditional values and public policy.

headlines.title: US revokes Petro's visa over call to disobey Trump
headlines.summary: Al Jazeera says the US revoked Petro's visa after his actions in New York, including calls to disobey Trump, signaling tension over protest diplomacy.

headlines.title: Trump hints at imminent Gaza deal as Middle East updates unfold
headlines.summary: Deutsche Welle says Trump suggests a Gaza ceasefire deal could be near, while Netanyahu rejects a Palestinian state, underscoring fragile negotiations.

headlines.title: Sarkozy verdict tests France's judicial independence under political pressure
headlines.summary: France 24 says Sarkozy's verdict exposes tensions between political power and judicial independence, highlighting a defining moment for France's institutional checks and future accountability.

headlines.title: Danish drone incursions linked to Russia raise hybrid warfare concerns
headlines.summary: France 24 says three ships with Russian links may have supported drones flight near Denmark, suggesting Russia's hybrid warfare strategy in the Baltic region.
